page.title: 03Long Marston Village Hall
page.content: Some clubs in Long Marston meet in the village hall. Built in l926, on land donated, its cost was raised by villagers. A cleaner/caretaker is employed by the elected committee. Money for maintenance and renovation is raised from events, a fete and Gala. Regular bookings include Clubs for Babies, Toddlers and Children, Women's Institute and Bridge sessions. During the year jumble sales, private functions, dances, parish council meetings and presentations for the Open Gardens Competition take place. This hall, unlike Pebworth's, stands between the shop and garage with no land around it which may account for the lack of vandalism.
